revised_title: Peridinin-Chlorophyll a Proteins in Symbiotic Dinoflagellates: Strain Identification and Potential Marker for Sexual Recombination
tldr: The authors studied the peridinin-chlorophyll a proteins (PCP) in the symbiotic dinoflagellate Symbiodinium microadriaticum, which is found in various marine invertebrates. They discovered that different strains of the dinoflagellate have distinct PCP conformers, which can be used as a tool for strain identification and potentially as a marker for sexual recombination. This research helps in understanding the population biology of these organisms and their relationship with their host species.
scientific_discipline: Biology and Life Sciences > Ecology and Evolution
